column17: The bomb was placed at the entrance to a Catholic Cardinal's residence in Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz, Bolivia.
column18: 04/15/2009: On Wednesday afternoon at about 1230, in Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz, Bolivia, a bomb placed at the entrance to a Catholic Cardinal's residence exploded, causing damage to the entrance and shattered the windows of the religious residence and many nearby residences but no casualties.  No group claimed responsibility.
column39: The bomb was placed at the entrance to a Catholic Cardinal's residence.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Unknown explosives were used in the attack.
column108: The explosion damaged the  entrance and shattered the windows of the religious residence and many nearby residences
column133: Many Residences Damaged in Bombing in Santa Cruz

column17: At a bus terminal in La Paz, La Paz, Bolivia.
column18: 08/12/2009: On Wednesday afternoon at approximately 1400, in La Paz, La Paz, Bolivia, a letter bomb exploded at a bus company, injuring five civilians, one of the victims is the wife of Fidel Surco, Leader of the National Council for Change (CONALCAM) who has close ties with the president Evo Morales. No group claimed responsibility.
column39: A bus terminal was targeted in the attack.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: A letter bomb was used in the attack.
column108: It Is unknown if the attack caused any property damage.
column133: \"\"Five Civilians Injured in Letter Bomb Attack in La Paz"

column17: At a construction company in La Paz, La Paz, Bolivia.
column18: 08/12/2009: On Wednesday afternoon, in La Paz, La Paz, Bolivia, a letter improvised explosive device planted at a construction company building exploded, injuring two firefighters called in to deactivate it. It is widely believe that the main target of the bombing was Edgar Gutierrez, a construction investor. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: An improvised explosive letter bomb was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of property damage.
column133: \"\"Two Firefighters Injured in Letter Bomb Attack in La Paz"

column18: 10/29/2012: Assailants armed with petrol set Fernando Vidal, an outspoken radio journalist, on fire during his show in Yacuiba city, Gran Chaco province, Tarija department, Bolivia. Vidal sustained serious burns in the assault, although he survived. In addition, a source reported that Karen Anza, a radio studio technician, was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, a source believed that the victim, Fernando Vidal, was attacked because he reported extensively on liquid petroleum smuggling and was an outspoken critic of the provincial government.
column129: 2012.\",\"\"\"Radio journalist set alight live on air after men burst into studio and pour petrol over him"
